head.supplied: 20/9/96 ¶ ¶ In the quietness of the Sunday, dear Madam, I looked also over the plants gathered by your friend at the Fitzroy-River. ¶ They interest me greatly, and I should be very much obliged to y...

div.p: Letters to Mrs Ryan of Eucla, acc. 2146A, Battye Library, Perth.

In the quietness of the Sunday, dear Madam, I looked also over the plants gathered by your friend at the Fitzroy-River.
WA. They interest me greatly, and I should be very much obliged to you if you would induce this Amateur Collector to forward to me as many sorts of plants from there as can be got conveniently, excluding such species as are common there. Kindly also let it be known there that among minute plants and floating weeds would be most novelty.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I will send valuable seeds to this Amateur Collector if I could learn his or her name.
